ARABIC: قَالُوا۟ سُبْحَٰنَ رَبِّنَآ إِنَّا كُنَّا ظَٰلِمِينَ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: They said, 'Glory be to our Lord! Truly we have been wrongdoers.'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Glory to our Lord," they said; we were really in the wrong."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: They cried out: “Glory be to our Lord! Certainly we were sinners.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: They said, "All glory belongs to God. We have certainly been unjust".
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: They said, “Purity is to our Lord – we have indeed been unjust.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: They said: "Glory to Our Lord! Verily, we have been wrongdoers."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: They said: Glory be to our Lord, surely we were unjust.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: They said, 'Glory be to God, our Lord; truly, we were evildoers.'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: They said: Glorified be our Lord! Lo! we have been wrong-doers.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: They said, "Glory be to God, our Lord. We have surely done wrong."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: They said: hallowed be Our Lord! verily we have been wrong- doers.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: They said, ‘Immaculate is our Lord! We have indeed been wrongdoers!’
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: They said: "Glory to our Lord! Verily we have been doing wrong!"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: They said: "Glory to Our Lord! Verily, we have been Zalimun (wrong-doers, etc.)."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: Exaltations to Allah, our Lord' they said, 'We were truly harmdoers'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: They said, “Glory to our Lord—We were indeed in the wrong.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: They said, "Exalted is our Lord! Indeed, we were wrongdoers."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [68:29] They said, ‘Glory be to God, our Lord. Verily we have been wrongdoers’, by denying the poor folk [what is] their due.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (They said: Glorified be our Lord!) We ask forgiveness of our Lord. (Lo! we have been wrong-doers) we harmed ourselves by our transgression and intention to deprive the needy ones and also by failing to say "Allah willing".
